name: Undo WordPress Default Formatting
author: Mattias Geniar

sections.description: WordPress applies default text formatting that replaces characters such as ‘-‘, ‘–‘, quotes, … to pretty HTML characters. This plugin was created to revert that back. This is especially useful for tech-oriented blogs that need the original input because they may contain commands that need to be executed.
sections.installation:
1. upload the directory “undo_wordpress_default_formatting” to your wp-content/plugins directory
  2. activate the plugin from your WordPress ‘Plugins’ menu
sections.faq:
The characters get replaced to something else than my original, why is that?

WordPress changes a few characters to the same HTML entity character. I can not guess what the original character was, so I’m using a ‘best effort’ way of converting the HTML character back to the original one. Sometimes, it’ll be wrong.

short_description: This plugin undoes some of the default formatting that gets applied to new posts created via Wordpress.
description: WordPress applies default text formatting that replaces characters such as ‘-‘, ‘–‘, quotes, … to pretty HTML characters. This plugin was created to revert that back. This is especially useful for tech-oriented blogs that need the original input because they may contain commands that need to be executed.

upgrade_notice.1.0: There is only 1 version so far, no upgrade notices yet.
